article.headline: Central Michigan 94, Ball State 89 (OT)
article.story: MOUNT PLEASANT, Mich. (AP) -- Gerrit Brigitha scored 29 points and pulled down 11 rebounds to lead Central Michigan to a 94-89 overtime win over Ball State on Saturday. Brigitha tied the game at 83-all with 1:18 left with a layup and nearly won the game in regulation, but his tip-in of a Kevin Nelson shot rimmed out. In overtime, the Chippewas (6-23, 2-16 Mid-American Conference) tied the game on a layup by Brigitha. Nelson and David Hoskins each hit 3-pointers to put the game out of reach with 2:13 left in the contest. Nelson finished with 27 points, including five 3-pointers, while Hoskins scored 15 points with six rebounds and seven assists. Dennis Trammell scored 23 points for Ball State (13-14, 10-8) while Peyton Stovall had 17, Cameron Echols 14, Terrance Chapman 13 and Roberts Owens 10. Both teams return to action Monday in the first round of the MAC tournament. The Chippewas are the No. 13 seed while Ball State's seeding had not been determined Saturday.
